channel.title: Formatting my computer?
channel.description:
Alright I am having a problem reformatting my computer. Basically what I want to do is reformat and install windows vista again. (don't suggest using a different os I don't really care)
Now my problem is that if I boot from my installation cd then it tells me that the cd key I am using cannot be used unless I install from the os I have on now. Also for the command "format C:" it says I do not have the rights to do that. When I put the cd in and open the installer when im on my os it tells me that to change the partitions on my drives I need to boot from the cd. Which I can not do. Now I want to know if there is any solution to this OTHER THAN SWITCH OPERATING SYSTEMS. I have looked on google for a while like the first 10 pages and it did not help.

item.title: Formatting my computer?
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:5, topic:191531”]billygotshot have you tried this:
Going into bios and selecting boot from CD.
Put the windows vista cd in and start the computer.
Then it should ask you if you want to install, and on what partition.
Then you should be able to format your hard drive from there.

It sounds simple to me, but you’ve tried that right?[/quote]

I figured it out and as i said before that did not work -.- you have to not enter a cd key which is retarded.

Read full topic

item.title: Formatting my computer?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

billygotshot have you tried this:
Going into bios and selecting boot from CD.
Put the windows vista cd in and start the computer.
Then it should ask you if you want to install, and on what partition.
Then you should be able to format your hard drive from there.

It sounds simple to me, but you’ve tried that right?

Read full topic
